author: newweiv
content: thanks, that makes sense. so findcontent/foundcontent are analogous to GET operation and o/a/s are analogous to INSERT. i see that in the spec, there are 2 places where offer/accept/store are used: finding content, and storing content. the storing content makes sense, since that's essentially what o/a/s seek to do, but why have an o/a/s chain be initiated after finding content? im guessing that it helps to make the network more self-reliable in a way

author: jacobkaufmann
content: It's a mechanism to distribute content to nodes "close" to the content that do not possess it so that they can also serve that content. Otherwise, subsequent requests might all go to the same node who responded with the content in the first request
